ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] CVode: ...failed repeatedly...|h| = min
ygData.msgSnippet: First of all, sorry for the long delay in replying.  I am on vacation and for the last few days I have not had internet access. This error message usually

First of all, sorry for the long delay in replying.  I am on vacation  
and for the last few days I have not had internet access.

This error message usually means that you are starting from an  
initial solution estimate that is unreasonable in some way. For  
example, starting a combustion simulation with only radicals could  
lead to this error, since the destruction rates are so rapid that the  
solver can't find any reasonable time step.

Another thing to consider is whether you are re-initializing the  
solver for each Fluent timestep. Usually you need to call CVInit or  
CVReinit at the beginning of each time step, because Fluent may have  
altered the solution vector in ways that CVode doesn't know about.   
In my own application codes that do something similar to what you are  
describing, I have found for some reason that CVReinit doesn't work  
(this is probably dependent on the CVode version) so I use CVInit.  
This slows down the code a bit due to unnecessary memory allocation/ 
deallocation, but works for me.

Dave


On Aug 11, 2006, at 8:16 AM, danielexr wrote:

> Hi, professor Goodwin.
> I'm simulating a channel of automotive catalytic converter.
> I'm studying the fluidynamics of the channel through Fluent 6.2.16,
> Linux, and for each face of the channel wall it's called Cantera, from
> fluent's "udf", looping over wall faces.
> I modeled the surface reactions with an "interface kinetics".
> I'm sending as input for the Cantera module: temperature of gas and
> wall, the species concentrations Yi  and the coverages of rhodium and
> platinum.
> I do advanceCoverages(dt) with dt=1, that is a time advance long
> enough to get the equilibrium.
> Sometimes, for some settings of inputs, i get the error message
> "..failed repeatedly or with |h| = hmin", when the Cantera function is
> called automatically by fluent.
> But, if i try to manually run the Cantera function with the same
> inputs, i don't get the error.
> Can you help me, please? Is it known a malfuctioning of cantera if
> called within the fluent/linux environment?
> Thanks a lot.
>
